dmp.title: The relationship between family income in the United States and child mortality - Detailed DMP
dmp.description: The resulting relationship is one of the most important objectives of the project. The relationship is to increase the family income in the United States with a decrease in the death rate of children aged 1 to 19 years from 1953 to 2015. In conclusion, this relationship can be confirmed in the future if household income increases. It can be applied to other countries

dataset.title: Child mortality rates and household income
dataset.description: Data showing The relationship between the data set of family income in the United States and the death rate among children aged 1-19 years 1953 to 2015
dataset.keyword: family income , child mortality , United States , datasets

metadata.description: Family income is a documented data set in the United States of America and The death rate of children is the death rate of children of 100,000 children in the United States, aged 1 to 19 years

distribution.title: Raw data
distribution.description: CSV file showing Child mortality rates in the United States and the proportion of family income from 1953 to 2015

host.title: ZenodoRepository
host.description: It was hosted on the site Zenodo
